sentences.en: Almond oil is renowned for its soothing, emollient properties.
sentences.cn: 杏仁油以其舒缓和滋润功效闻名。

sentences.en: Famous for its legendary natural emollient and moisturizing a great addition to your shower or bath.
sentences.cn: 非凡的天然润肤保湿功效,令你的沐浴体验与众不同.

sentences.en: Its tooth sharp benefit is emollient andtorn to pieces an alimental function in the mastication.
sentences.cn: 它的牙尖锐利有力,在咀嚼中起撕碎食物的作用.

sentences.en: Mr Bush now has an opportunity to revamp his reputation by adopting a more emollient style.
sentences.cn: 现在布什采取的风格柔和一点的话,则有机会对其名誉和威望来个翻新补修.

sentences.en: The choice of emollient should be made taking into account budgetary limitations and ease of supply.
sentences.cn: 选择润肤剂应考虑到预算的多少，以及是否容易供应。

sentences.en: The mist contains sunflower oil, a natural emollient that sinks into your skin and conditioned.
sentences.cn: 含有具天然保湿作用的向日葵油, 深入滋润皮肤.

sentences.en: The northerners'initial response has been emollient.
sentences.cn: 北方人的最初反应便是尽量缓和时局.

sentences.en: Use an emollient for dry skin.
sentences.cn: 乾燥的皮肤要使用润肤剂.

trans.tran_cn: 使柔软的，安慰性的，起镇静作用的
trans.tran_en: making someone feel calmer when they have been angry
An emollient is a liquid or cream that you put on your skin to make it softer or to reduce pain
